Business & Economics.name: Capitalism Chronicles
Business & Economics.description: Delve into the core concepts of economics and business with this quiz. From historical figures to modern corporations, test your knowledge of the forces that shape our world.

questions.text: What is the proletariat?
questions.hint: This term, used in Marxist theory, refers to those who earn wages through labor.

questions.text: Which of these is a commonly-known investment account?
questions.hint: This account’s initials stand for ‘Individual Retirement Account.’

questions.text: By what nickname is the Federal National Mortgage Association known?
questions.hint: This nickname is derived from a female first name, reflecting the organization's acronym.

questions.text: When it first appeared on the Internet, amazon.com sold only what?
questions.hint: The company started as an online bookstore before expanding to everything.

questions.text: If a business files under Chapter 11 what is it doing?
questions.hint: This legal action allows a company to reorganize while managing debts.

questions.text: What internet company goes by the acronym AOL?
questions.hint: This company was a pioneer in dial-up internet services in the 1990s.

questions.text: Which of these is a government agency established to protect investors?
questions.hint: This agency’s initials stand for ‘Securities and Exchange Commission.’

questions.text: What corporation was founded by a candlemaker and a soapmaker?
questions.hint: This company is a household name for products like Tide and Pampers.
